sentence: Ms. TLAIB. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 89.

Ms. TITUS. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the floor and missed roll  call votes numbered 286 through 288.

Had I been present, I would have voted:

Yea on Roll Call No. 286, H.R. 1608--The Department of Homeland  Security Vehicular Terrorism Prevention and Mitigation Act of 2025;

Yea on Roll Call No. 287,…
Ms. BROWNLEY. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote today. Had I been  present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 77.

Mr. CORREA. Mr. Speaker, I was necessarily absent and missed the  following votes on the House Floor. Had I been present, I would have  voted accordingly: NAY on Roll Call No. 166, Passage of S. 331; YEA on  Roll Call No. 167, Motion to Recommit on H.R. 4; NAY on Roll Call No.  168, Passage of H.R. 4;…
Ms. CROCKETT. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 333 and NAY on Roll Call No. 334.                             personal explanation
Ms. PETTERSEN. Mr. Speaker, I recently gave birth and am unable to  travel to D.C. to vote. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on  Roll Call No. 61 and NAY on Roll Call No. 62.
Mr. SUBRAMANYAM. Madam Speaker, I regret that I was not present to  vote on Roll Call No. 115. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 115.

Mr. COSTA. Mr. Speaker, returning from a speaking event downtown and  5:00 p.m. traffic delayed me from making the votes. Had I been present,  I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 319 and YEA on Roll Call No.  320.

Mr. GOMEZ. Mr. Speaker, today, I was not recorded on Roll Call Nos.  303 and 304. Had I been present, I would have voted ``NAY'' on Roll  Call No. 303 and ``NAY'' on Roll Call No. 304.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mrs. RAMIREZ. Mr Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 85, H.R. 997.                             personal explanation

Mr. AUCHINCLOSS. Mr. Speaker, I was necessarily absent from votes  today. Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 308  and NO on Roll Call No. 309.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

Mr. WILSON of South Carolina. Mr. Speaker, I was otherwise…
Mr. GOTTHEIMER. Mr. Speaker, I missed the following votes, but had I  been present, I would have voted: YEA on Roll Call No. 74, NAY on Roll  Call No. 75, and NO on Roll Call No. 76.
Mrs. TRAHAN. Mr. Speaker, I was not present for votes today. Had I  been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 160 and NAY on  Roll Call No. 161.
Ms. LEE of Nevada. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have  voted NAY on Roll Call No. 51.
Mr. DeSAULNIER. Mr. Speaker, I regret that I was unable to vote  today, as I was unavoidably detained. Had I been present, I would have  voted YEA on Roll Call No. 123, H. Con. Res. 30.

Mr. BRECHEEN. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably detained due to illness  and was not able to cast my vote on Roll Call No. 183 and 184. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 183 and YEA on  Roll Call No. 184.                   announcement by the speaker pro tempore

Mr. HILL of Arkansas. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote because I was  in a legislative meeting which ran over. Had I been present, I would  have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 77.

Stated against:

Mr. CARTER of Georgia. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have  voted YEA on Roll Call No. 220, H.R. 747, as amended.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

Mr. GOLDMAN of New York. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote today…

Mr. WOMACK. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably absent and unable to vote.  Had I been present, I would have voted NAY on Roll Call No. 345, NAY on  Roll Call No. 346, YEA on Roll Call No. 347, NAY on Roll Call No. 348,  YEA on Roll Call No. 349, NAY on Roll Call No. 350, and…

Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 175.
